parameters:
\N<Ryuda Soldier>This is the archive where we store the records of Ryuda's
military campaigns. It contains records of engagements,
battle results, and even documents on prisoners of war.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hey, what have you been doing since a while ago? Do you have
some business here?

\N<Segi>(Wait... Didn't Rozaro-san, Zuuteruka, and the owner of the
armory say something?)
It seems I defeated some bandits.

\N<Segi>(At this rate, even though I've come all this way, I won't
be able to investigate anything...)
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hey, are you listening? What are you doing, I asked.

\N<Segi>(...That's right. Fubii... that child once said they single-
handedly defeated a bandit.)

\N<Segi>(If that's the case, it must have been a very noticeable
incident... There might be books related to that event
here.)
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hey, are you listening? What are you doing, I asked.

\N<Segi>Ah, well... as a citizen of the town... and as a participant
in the training corps, I thought I'd like to know a bit
about your records and history.

\N<Segi>...I came here today to look into that. May I have your
permission...?
\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hmm, well alright. Do as you like.

\N<Segi>(Even if I find books related to the incident, whether there
will be any results is a fifty-fifty chance... but I'll look
into it. It's surely better than doing nothing.)

\N<Segi>(Fubii... they talked about participating in the training
corps, but where did they come from in the first place...?)
\N<Ryuda Soldier>...Well, fine. Do as you like.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Hmm... So you've succeeded in exterminating the master of
the ruins. I shall promptly record this as a military
achievement.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>You've done well. As a reward, I will grant you access to
peruse a portion of our Ryuda's records of military exploits
stored here.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>Continue to strive in the future. That is what gives value
to both you and the people of this city.

\N<Segi>...This is the only library in town, but... I wonder if we
can find any information about that person here.

\N<Segi>Besides, ever since Lyuda's soldiers came, most of the books
have been replaced with their propaganda materials.
\N<Segi>In such a place... personal records of him...

"Ryuda Expedition Record 2" Independent Night Watch Nation
"Dawn's Ear" military record. In the private chambers of the
Grand Duke and Princess Consort Suia.

"Ryuda Expedition Record 1" - At the home of Orugi, the
former vigilante leader, and his wife Seno, in the
independent night-watch nation "Dawn's Ear."
